com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.nio
Class SelectingThread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.thread.SpecializedThread
          com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.nio.SelectingThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
Registrar, Runnable
public abstract class SelectingThread
extends SpecializedThread
implements Registrar

A selector-backed thread for managing channels.

Constructor Detail

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread()
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread. The thread will use the system-wide default selector provider.

Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread(String name)
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread that will have the given name. The thread will use the system-wide default selector provider.

Parameters:
name - the name of the new thread
Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread(ThreadGroup group)
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread that will belong to the specified thread group. The thread will use the system-wide default selector provider.

Parameters:
group - the thread group
Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread(ThreadGroup group,
                       String name)
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread that will belong to the specified thread group and have the given name. The thread will use the system-wide default selector provider.

Parameters:
group - the thread group
name - the name of the new thread
Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread(ThreadGroup group,
                       String name,
                       long stackSize)
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread that will belong to the specified thread group and have the given name and stack size. The thread will use the system-wide default selector provider.

Parameters:
group - the thread group
name - the name of the new thread
stackSize - the desired stack size, or zero to ignore this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

SelectingThread

public SelectingThread(SelectorProvider provider)
                throws IOException
Allocates a new selecting thread that will use the specified selector provider.

Parameters:
provider - the selector provider to use, or null to use the system-wide default
Throws:
IOException - if the selector provider propagates an I/O error during the open operation

Method Detail

work

protected void work()
Selects channels that are ready for I/O operations and handles them. Stops when the thread is interrupted.

Overrides:
work in class SpecializedThread

cleanUp

protected void cleanUp()
Closes the selector used by this thread.

Overrides:
cleanUp in class SpecializedThread

handleSelectException

protected void handleSelectException(IOException e)
Defines how this thread deals with an I/O exception thrown during the select process. The default behavior is to report it and interrupt the thread. Subclasses should override this if needed.

Parameters:
e - the thrown exception

handleCloseException

protected void handleCloseException(IOException e)
Defines how this thread deals with an I/O exception thrown during the close process. The default behavior is to report it.

Parameters:
e - the thrown exception

accept

protected void accept(SelectionKey key)
Defines how this thread handles a key that's ready for accepting. Default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
key - the key to handle

connect

protected void connect(SelectionKey key)
Defines how this thread handles a key that's ready for connection. Default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
key - the key to handle

read

protected void read(SelectionKey key)
Defines how this thread handles a key that's ready for reading. Default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
key - the key to handle

write

protected void write(SelectionKey key)
Defines how this thread handles a key that's ready for writing. Default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
key - the key to handle

register

public SelectionKey register(SelectableChannel channel,
                             int ops)
                      throws ClosedChannelException
Registers a channel with this thread's selector, returning a selection key with the specified interest set and a null attachment. This method is equivalent to calling register(channel, ops, null).

Specified by:
register in interface Registrar
Parameters:
channel - the channel to register
ops - the desired interest set for the resulting key
Returns:
a key representing the registration
Throws:
ClosedChannelException - if the channel is closed

register

public SelectionKey register(SelectableChannel channel,
                             int ops,
                             Object attachment)
                      throws ClosedChannelException
Registers a channel with this thread's selector, returning a selection key with the specified interest set and attachment.

Specified by:
register in interface Registrar
Parameters:
channel - the channel to register
ops - the desired interest set for the resulting key
attachment - the attachment for the resulting key, may be null
Returns:
a key representing the registration
Throws:
ClosedChannelException - if the channel is closed

deregister

public void deregister(SelectableChannel channel)
Cancels the given channel's registration.

Specified by:
deregister in interface Registrar
Parameters:
channel - the channel to deregister
